It is running very very slow, i put 6 charts in one dashboard.
If the query are slow there's not much other options thn optimize your data / database / query. Or add a cache.

@xrmx Do you mean that add a cache when doing slice? It has been added.
Normally how to deal with big volume data with Superset? Actually it's not so big...

If your goal is simply to show a static dash, caching should happen normally. There are endpoints that can be called to warm up the cache programatically. Of course if people explore that table then those slices will cache as they go.

Then it's about making your DB faster. Not much Superset can do here, but you can change your data model, have more summarized tables, use partitions or indices, ... It's very specific to what you're up to and your DB engine.
I guess the widget header in the dashboard could evolve to expose more options, perhaps the ones that are not very commonly used could be buried in a popover
It requires a bit of work to be fixed
Thanks for answer and all the great work here. Hope it will arrive soon.

@vavrusa for what's it's worth we have 700+ weekly active (and it's growing quickly) at Airbnb so we're going to focus more on quality moving forward. It's an act of balance between adding functionality and stabilizing it, we're starting to focus more on the quality/UX for sure though.

We're still very ambitious and bullish and want to keep moving fast, so for folks looking for perfection it may not be the right choice at the moment.
I think FK management in Alembic has shortcomings on some DB engine.

One thing that has helped us a lot on large data volumes using the SQLAlchemy connection (like MySQL or Postgres) is making sure that there are appropriate indices on the time column. Superset almost always constrains a query to a particular period of time based on some column in the data and without an index on this column the query can run very very slow.

@mistercrunch I didn't mean it in a bad way, it's just doesn't work for my use case. I'm sure it is fine for smaller datasets or teams. It's a 0.x version after all and I'm sure it'll be much better over time.
@dmzaytsev I'm using Grafana with panel extensions (histogram, heatmap, datatable, pie, sunburst) currently with https://github.com/vavrusa/grafana-sqldb-datasource datasource to enable ClickHouse.

I had the same issue. To fix, change your SQL Alchemy URI from `redshift+psycopg2://...` to `postgresql+psycopg2://...`

Solution found [here](https://github.com/airbnb/superset/issues/2364).
@alexdebrie That worked for me. Thanks for your help!

This is especially an issue for colorblind users. The hover legend is often the only way I can make sense of stacked graph. It may be possible to automatically choose from one of a few different palettes, as there are several different forms of colorblindness with well-documented methods (like daltonizing) to improve legibility, but allowing users to create custom palettes would be sufficient. It would be ideal to implement this in a way that's persistent for a given client across dashboards, so it's not necessary to customize every single page.
So documentation is wrong? If so anyone care to do a patch please? http://airbnb.io/superset/installation.html#database-dependencies
See [2447](https://github.com/airbnb/superset/pull/2447).
pushing this through as a hotfix

I recently ran into this as well when trying to use a AWS load-balancer to a container and fixed it the following way.

1. superset v0.17.1 with docker image: python:3.6
2. Set `ENABLE_PROXY_FIX = True` in `superset_config.py`
3. Used a Application Load Balancer (ALB) instead of a classic ELB going to the container port over http and https

i download the source code and initially it is a nomal file /root/superset-master/superset/assets, when install,an error occurs : can't found /root/superset-master/superset/static/assets/backendSync.json NO such file
so i remove this file and make a soft link 
[root@test2 build]# cd /root/superset-master/superset/static/
[root@test2 build]# touch /root/superset-master/superset/static/assets
../assets
[root@test2 build]# rm -f assets
[root@test2 build]# ln -s ../assets/ assets
[root@test2 static]# ls -la
total 8
lrwxrwxrwx.  1 root root   10 Mar 22 00:14 assets -> ../assets/
i am not sure there is any influence on that?

Superset build frontend code on superset/assets. But when you start superset, it will download assets of frontend from superset/static/assets. So superset's author made this soft link. If you've moved superset's code, the soft link will be broken. Even though you've execute npm install and npm run build. There are no dist and node_modules directory under superset/static/assets, which will cause your problem.
You could embed a dashboard instead of embedding individual charts. You can suffix the dashboard url with `?standalone=true` to not render the menu bar.

Yeah this looks like a regression from the connector rework. @mistercrunch i've tried to get the view from the flask blueprint registry but *surprise* i get only blueprints from there and not the actual view class. Should we add a list of related view to the datasource model or we should add a new item in the config like we do for datasources?

```
export PYTHONPATH=$WHEREYOURCONFIGIS:$PYTHONPATH
```
should do the trick, where of course WHEREYOURCONFIGIS is the path of the superset_config with the mysql database.
Possibly broken because of #2437 ?
Possibly this has been fixed in a later version?

| user  | CREATE TABLE `user` (
